I have just finished posting my entry into the NEAT world:  
https://source=
forge.net/projects/aipac

AIPac (or PacAI - I tend to swap them) is a progr=
am that evolves a 
controller for PacMan using NEAT.  I tried to develop th=
e code as 
flexibly as possible and the result allows control over the maze=
s, 
character positions, graphics, etc.  I think it is reasonably 
flexible=
 enough for some interesting experiments.  These details as 
well as NEAT p=
arameters are controlled through a parameter file.

Currently, the inputs t=
o the net are defined as a window centered on 
PacMan and extending 6 tiles=
 in each direction.  The result is a 
13x13 window within which there are i=
ndependent inputs for walls, 
dots, empty space, and ghosts of various flav=
ors.  There's also an 
example (WMV) of the best run I've seen thus far usi=
ng this scheme.

Please head over to SourceForge and give it a run.  If you=
 have any 
problems, post in the Forums at SourceForge.

-Kirk
